snippet: European finance ministers announced the agreement after an emergency meeting, giving Greece breathing room on its economic and financial troubles.
abstract: European leaders agree to four-month extension of Greek bailout, allowing country to avoid bankruptcy and its attendant destabilizing consequences for region; agreement stipulates that Greece will not receive 240 billion euros in funds unless it meets certain conditions, raising possibility of further negotiations.

byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and JAMES KANTER
byline.contributor: Landon Thomas Jr. contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: European finance ministers announced the agreement after an emergency meeting, giving Greece breathing room on its economic and financial troubles.

headline.main: Eurozone Officials Reach Accord With Greece to Extend Bailout
headline.print_headline: Longer Lifeline on Greek Aid, With Caveats
